business.headline: Sensex, Nifty open flat as cautious sentiment prevails in marketsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 76.81 points to 78,598.37, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 75 points to 23,808.45.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Elon Musk, Vivek Ramaswamy to lead DOGE to clean up bureaucracy: TrumpIn a statement, Trump said Musk and Ramaswamy "will pave the way for my administration to dismantle government bureaucracy, slash excess regulations, cut wasteful expenditures, and restructure federal agencies".

Delhi gas chamber: Thick smog, air quality drops to 'very poor' levelAQI in Delhi: Aya nagar recorded the worst air quality in the city with an AQI of 417 at 8 am on Wednesday, which falls under the severe category, according to the data by the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB).

INDIA or NDA? 43 Jharkhand seats up for grabs in high-stakes Phase 1 polling todayIn Jharkhand's first election phase, high-profile candidates like Champai Soren, Banna Gupta, and Geeta Koda take center stage as 43 constituencies go to polls, setting the stage for a fierce political battle between the INDIA bloc and the NDA.
Trump picks Ratcliffe as CIA director, Kash Patel misses outJohn Ratcliffe, a close ally of Trump, served as director of national intelligence at the end of his first term.

Indians dream of life in US, but why are Americans fleeing the country?Indians even use the risky Donkey Route for a life in the US. However, Americans are choosing a life outside the US, according to reports and online discussions. AmerExit became a hot topic after Donald Trump's victory. Who are these Americans fleeing the US, and why are they doing so?

Wayanad test for Priyanka Gandhi Vadra today, voting for bypoll beginsHigh-stakes voting began at 7 am today in Wayanad, where a three-way contest marks Priyanka Gandhi's electoral debut as she aims to retain Congress's stronghold, once held by Rahul Gandhi.

Vivek Ramaswamy: The Indian-American who dropped presidential bid to back TrumpVivek Ramaswamy, a 38-year-old born in Ohio to immigrant parents from India, ended his White House bid in January this year and endorsed Donald Trump for President.

Bulldozer justice: Supreme Court to frame guidelines on demolishing propertiesThe top court will also decide on framing nationwide guidelines aimed at preventing the "illegal" demolition of homes and other properties.

How risky can your partner's kiss really be?When your partner's kiss leaves your skin red and itchy, you're likely dealing with beard burn. While it can be uncomfortable and even lead to infections, the good news is that it's usually easy to treat and manage.

RCB failed to chase down a target of 209 despite fifties from Chris Gayle and Virat Kohli.

Live: Rahul Gandhi urges votes for INDIA bloc to bring prosperity in JharkhandJharkhand Election 2024 Phase 1 Live Updates: Voting for the first phase of the Jharkhand Assembly elections, covering 43 out of 81 constituencies, began at 7 am today. As many as 683 candidates are in the fray for legislative seats, which include 17 general, 20 reserved for Scheduled Tribes, and six reserved for Scheduled Castes. In the 2019 Jharkhand Assembly election, Hemant Soren-led JMM won 30 seats, the BJP won 25 and Congress won 16 seats.

Mithun Chakraborty's wallet stolen at BJP rally, organisers appeal for its returnVideos from the rally reveal significant lapses in security at the venue, leading to a chaotic situation where several BJP supporters managed to climb onto the stage to take photos with Mithun Chakraborty. Amidst the commotion, Chakraborty's wallet was stolen.

Can Champai Soren, once a Hemant Soren's fill-in, defend his stronghold for BJP?Champai Soren, who is the BJP candidate for Sareikela Assembly elections, has won the constituency since the first Assembly elections in Jharkhand in 2005.

Who is John Ratcliffe, former US spy tapped by Trump as CIA director?On his social media platform, Truth Social, Trump described John Ratcliffe as a "warrior for truth and honesty with the American public."  Ratcliffe was also declared as the nation's top spy in May 2020, eight months before Trump left office.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.
